channel.title: Sheriff rework suggestion
channel.description:
There was a thread yesterday about how sheriff is boring and too black and white. No need to put any pieces together which is what makes this game fun. I agree 100% sheriff is so boring. Here is my proposal.
Investigation should allow you to pick a target to investigate and pick a night either the current night or a previous night. And then you can see who the target visited on the night you chose. That way you have to put pieces of the puzzle together and you can fact check people's logs and try to find the person who visited somebody the night they died. It's very similar to how a sheriff acts IRL. That'd be a much more exciting role to play!

item.title: Sheriff rework suggestion
item.dc:creator: CN73DRUMMER
item.description:
Observer can only look at the current night. Say somebody suspicious puts up logs claiming knight saying the guarding king N3. Sheriff can then use investigate that night and choose that person and choose N3 and see if that person indeed visited the king that night.

Or let’s say somebody dies N2. Sheriff can check different people the next couple nights to see who they visited N2 and call them out if somebody did visit that person N2. He does detective work. You know the age old sheriff question “where were you the night so and so died” well this sheriff rework can find out. And like I said verify people’s logs after they post them. So sheriff is still basically as powerful as the current one, but is more fun and less just click and see.
